item.title: (pi) rep++
item.dc:creator: @we_we_we_so_excited we we we so excited
item.description:
@we_we_we_so_excited wrote:

[quote=“durial12, post:7, topic:390483”]See if he can use the client to access other servers too. (Assuming he knows how to change the IP’s).

There may be something still set to “localhost” somewhere, use ZFileSearcher to have a quick look.[/quote]With PI clients, this is the only thing you have to change to connect to a server.

public client() { tabHPos = -1; fullscreenInterfaceID = -1; chatRights = new int[500]; chatTypeView = 0; clanChatMode = 0; cButtonHPos = -1; cButtonHCPos = -1; cButtonCPos = 0; server = "localhost";

Read full topic

item.description:

See if he can use the client to access other servers too. (Assuming he knows how to change the IP’s).

There may be something still set to “localhost” somewhere, use ZFileSearcher to have a quick look.

item.title: (pi) rep++
item.dc:creator: @we_we_we_so_excited we we we so excited
item.description:
@we_we_we_so_excited wrote:

Make sure you sent him the one that has your no-ip in it, and again, check if you have enabled it in your firewall settings.

Read full topic

item.title: (pi) rep++
item.dc:creator: @Agent_Jugz Agent Jugz
item.description:
@Agent_Jugz wrote:

In client.java client sided I changed my ip to 127.0.0.1 and the gui to revolutionx.zapto.org, I could login, but my friend couldn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: (pi) rep++
item.dc:creator: @we_we_we_so_excited we we we so excited
item.description:
@we_we_we_so_excited wrote:

Well you never said anything about your friend trying, and I don’t know if you say you’ve set it up correctly you must have. You might also have to allow it in your firewall settings or disable your firewall.

Also, logging in with localhost should work.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Agent_Jugz Agent Jugz
item.description:
@Agent_Jugz wrote:

Yeh I tryed that, but my friend said he still couldn’t login.

Read full topic

item.title: (pi) rep++
item.dc:creator: @we_we_we_so_excited we we we so excited
item.description:
@we_we_we_so_excited wrote:

Try have a separate client, one with the no-ip that you give to others and one personally for you with the server set to localhost. I have problems when trying to use my no-ip to log into a server, but it’s fine if I have it set to localhost.

Read full topic

item.title: (pi) rep++
item.dc:creator: @Agent_Jugz Agent Jugz
item.description:
@Agent_Jugz wrote:

So for some reason my Project Insanity isn’t working.

I’ve portforwarded correctly, I change Server = (client sided) in client.java to my ip, then in server sided I got to server.java and change my ip in there, compile both, run and I can’t login.

I know I’ve portforwarded correctly because if I use the same server and I login with a different client I can login, but not with this one.

Just to let everyone know I change the ip in client.java and in gui.java (client sided).

public Gui(String args[]) { super(); try { UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName()); sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName("revolutionx.zapto.org")); initUI(); } catch(Exception ex) { ex.printStackTrace(); } That’s my GUI where I changed the ip and this is my client.java where I changed the ip;

public client() { tabHPos = -1; fullscreenInterfaceID = -1; chatRights = new int[500]; chatTypeView = 0; clanChatMode = 0; cButtonHPos = -1; cButtonHCPos = -1; cButtonCPos = 0; server = "revolutionx.zapto.org";

Read full topic
